oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-05-31 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 31, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, Rod Brasfield, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 973rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Jordanaires; Wilburn Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Hank Garland; Rod Brasfield
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- House Of Glass (Ernest Tubb, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Jordanaires -- This Little Light Of Mine (Jordanaires) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Wilburn Brothers -- My Baby Ain't My Baby No More (Wilburn Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Katy Hill (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- What A Friend We Have In Jesus (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb and Grant Turner introduce Hank Garland -- Big Guitar (Hank Garland) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Byrd, Billy; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Wilburn Brothers; Wilburn, Teddy; Wilburn, Doyle
